meanings.sent1: He tried to gyps his friend out of his lunch money.
meanings.sent2: The con artist would often gyps unsuspecting tourists out of their savings.
meanings.sent3: The magician joked that he could gyps the audience into thinking he could fly.
meanings.sent4: Her smile could gyps even the most skeptical person into believing her lies.
meanings.sent5: The sneaky fox would always find a way to gyps the other animals out of their food.

meanings.sent1: The gyps was known for his smooth talk and quick schemes.
meanings.sent2: Beware of that gyps; he will try to trick you out of your money.
meanings.sent3: The gyps at the market sold fake jewelry to unsuspecting customers.
meanings.sent4: She saw him as a gyps, always looking for an opportunity to deceive others.
meanings.sent5: In the old western town, the gyps was the most feared person around.
